greeting: Hi,I am KEC Chatbot.If you have any questions,feel free to ask.
goodbye: Thankyou for using our Chatbot.Have a great day.
error: Please ask questions in undrestandable form.
courses:
Bachelor courses offered are:Bachelors in Architecture,
 Bachelors in Civil Engineering,
Bachelors in Computer Engineering,
Bachelors in Electrical Engineering,
Bachelors in Electronics Communication and Information Engineering
applicationchecklist:
The applicant needs to provide the following materials:
• Character certificates, mark sheets, and transcripts for SLC, ISC, 10+2, I.E., A Level, and CBSE
• One picture of each parent or guardian and two passport-sized images of the student.
• A duplicate of their passport
• Migration certificate; • 200-marks math certificate for applicants in the biological or physical group.
• The original score card from IOE, Pulchowk, must to be turned in when applying for admission.
attendance: In order to participate in the IOE final test, students must maintain a minimum of 75% attendance.
disqualification:
A student will be subject to disqualification if they: • Don't keep up a minimum of 75% attendance for the entire semester.
• The student fails to pass the tests that are given over the semester. The subject teacher in question must make the recommendation for disqualification.
idcard: While on college property, students must always have the identity card that was issued to them.
uniform:
The following is the required student attire:
The college-mandated tie, black shoes, a white shirt, and a navy blue coat, jacket, or coat
computerhod: Er. Sudeep Shakya is the HOD of computer faculty.
architecuterhod: Ar. Moon Singh Dongol is the HOD of architecture faculty.
electronicshod: Er. Rajan Lama is the HOD of electronics faculty.
electricalhod: Er. Binod Bhandari is the HOD of electrical faculty.
mechanicalhod: Er. Manchan Tiwari is the HOD of mechanical faculty.
civilhod: Er. Arjun Poudel is the HOD of civil faculty.
clubsintro: KEC has the following clubs: Kec Electrical Club, Robotics Club, Electronics Project Club (EPC), AKAR (Association Of KEC Architecture), KEC IT Club,CESA-KEC, and KEC Yoga Club.
electricalclub: KEC Electrical Club is for electrical engineering students who want to learn more about the field.Workshops, software simulation trainings, lecture programs, and the printing of the annual journal SYNERGY are among the activities organized by the club.
roboticsclub: Kathmandu Engineering College's (KEC) Robotics Club is a student-run club created by active and enthusiastic seniors who are passionate about robotics. Robotics Club has been a forerunner in introducing robotics knowledge and technology to KEC.
epclub: Electronics Project Club (EPC) is an open platform for students and electronic Kathmandu Engineering College,. The club's purpose is to provide initial training for working with electronic equipment, specifications on hardware/software design and maintenance, and workshops on Embedded System Design, Automation, and Autonomous Robotics.
akarclub: AKAR is known for its active commitment and participation in a range of educational and non-academic campaigns. AKAR offers an environment for students' creative ideas to grow into a reality. AKAR provides an opportunity for students to expose and improve their creativity through exhibitions, workshops, and challenges.
itclub: KEC IT Club is a student group that provides students with the opportunity to learn on the latest technology in the computer company. The major goal of this club is to share ideas in the IT field and inspiring collaboration, allowing students understand the potential and future of the software industry as a whole.
cesaclub: Civil Engineering Student Association (CESA) is a non-profit, non-political association of Civil Engineering students at KEC.CESA is open to any civil engineering student.Students that support CESA can also become members.
yogaclub: An essential component of KEC is yoga.KEC conducts a number of programs on how to improve your personality and develop life skills through yoga and meditation.
civilengineeringseats: There are 96 total seats available for civil engineering each year.
computerengineeringseats: There are 96 total seats available for computer engineering each year.
electricalengineeringseats: There are 48 total seats available for electrical engineering each year.
electronicsengineeringseats: There are 96 total seats available for electronics engineering each year.
architectureseats: There are 48 total seats available for architecture each year.
boyshostel: KEC has a modern boys hostel on its premises. With a warden, guards, and service staff, it has a strong security system.
girlshostel: There is a girls' hostel at KEC. The hostel is an excellent place to study and focus because of its wonderful atmosphere. Complete with a warden, guard, and service staff, it has an outstanding security system.
principal: KEC's principal is Prof. Er. Hirendra Man Pradhan.
chairman: KEC's chairman is Prof. Er. Hirendra Man Pradhan.
viceprincipal: KEC's vice principal is Associate Prof. Shailita Manandhar Joshi.
projectinfo: Project is listed under IOE syllabus named as minor and major for some faculties and only major for other,Please ask about respective faculty
computerprojects: We have two projects in the computer faculty: minor projects and major projects.The fifth and sixth semesters have been utilized for minor projects, and the seventh and eighth semesters have been utilized for major projects.
electronicsprojects: We have two projects in the electronics faculty: minor projects and major projects.The fifth and sixth semesters have been utilized for minor projects, and the seventh and eighth semesters have been utilized for major projects.
electricalprojects: We have one project in the electrical faculty:major project.The the seventh and eighth semesters have been utilized for major projects.
civilprojects: We have one project in the civil faculty:major project.The the seventh and eighth semesters have been utilized for major projects.
defenseproject: We have proposal defense, mid-term defense, pre-final defense, and final defense taken at specific intervals in between project.
projectsupervisor: Every project group has a supervisor assigned to it so that students can more easily communicate any issues or confusion they may be having with their project.
presentationdefenseproject: The defense presentation will take ten minutes in total.
projectmarks: For a project, the full marks is 75.
internalmarks: For a project, the college gets a total of 50 marks
externalmarks: For a project, the externak gives a total of 25 marks
exam: There are total 3 internal exams which includes two A.D.Ts and one final assessment. These exams are conducted each month. Full Marks for an A.D.T is 20 and Pass marks is 8. Full Marks for final internal exam (Assessment) is 50 and Pass Marks is 20. Before the actual date,routine and notice of the class arrangement for that particular adt will be released, indicating where we must go based on our roll number for that particular class.
adtfail: A student will not be qualified to sit for the IOE board exam if they receive failing grades on all of the exams administered by college for internal marks.
totalinternlmarks: A student must receive a passing score of 8 out of 20 internal marks in order to be eligible for the boards exam.
collegetime: The college is open from 9:00 am to 5:00 pm, Monday through Friday. Although a class period lasts 45 minutes, an hour and forty-five minutes are often dedicated to a particular subject with 45 minutes of break once a day.
collegelocation: Our college is located at kalimati,kathmandu.For detailed direction visit here
